resources.string: FamPad
Let me know you
All questions are between the scale 0 – 4 with 0 being definitely disagree to 4 being definitely agree.
1.Your partner is very controlling of you
2.Your partner is jealous of your success
3.When you make small mistakes, your partner gets very angry
4.Your partner hates some of your characteristics
5.You are sometimes very afraid of your partner
6.You\'re terrified to tell your partner anything he or she doesn\'t approve of.
7.Your partner lies to you very often.
8.Your partner has blackmailed you for something
9.Your partner has used violence against you
10.Your partner is extremely addicted to a substance
11.You are sure that you or anyone in your family has been hurt

FamPad is with you in every step of the way in ending the abuse you are subjected to. Together, we will ensure that you are happy and free again! Please answer the questions as accurately as possible to show the most appropriate content to you.
1.What age category do you belong to?
2.Which gender does your partner associate themselves with?
3.How long back did you observe the first signs of abuse?
4.Have you ever been physically hit, burnt, beaten or bruised?
5.Have you ever felt physically scared of your partner?
6.Has your partner ever threatened to harm you?
7.Do you think your partner is financially controlling?
8.Do you ever get scared while discussing finances with your partner?
9.Do you ever lie or have caught your partner lie while talking about money?
10.Do you ever feel like you are mentally tortured or stuck?
11.Do you often feel low around your partner?
12.Do you ever think your partner is harassing you or blackmailing you?
13.Do you have a kid or kids with your partner?

Two password should be same!

Action Plan
Exploration
Please choose the resources to be visualized
Impact/Assistance
The assistance male Recipients receive from Centrelink
● Remember there are no correct or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any statement.

● In the next couple of pages, you will be presented with a a series of statements. Please read each statement and select a level between 0 and 4 which indicates how much the statement was relevant to you over the past week.
This self-assessment test should take about 2 minutes to complete.
● The content will contain but not limited to self-help curriculum, essential resources, data visualisation and self-assessment tools.
Note: There are hundreds of other known domestic violence types that are not covered here.
● We will aim to identify the kind of domestic violence your are subjected to and take into your account your factors while displaying a specially curated content.
● You will be shown a series of questions. Choose the most suitable answer according to your situation.
Now that you have a fair idea of you situation, let us understand you better to help you.
Instruction
Set your Goal:
Submit
Show Completed Tasks
Confirm
Tasks Completed:

Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, of number four, Privet Drive, were proud to say that they were perfectly normal, thank you very much. They were the last people you\'d expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious, because they just didn\'t hold with such nonsense.
Congratulation! You have already completed all the tasks!
Harry Potter and the Sorcerer‘s Stone

Mr. Dursley was the director of a firm called Grunnings, which made drills. He was a big, beefy man with hardly any neck, although he did have a very large mustache. Mrs. Dursley was thin and blonde and had nearly twice the usual amount of neck, which came in very useful as she spent so much of her time craning over garden fences, spying on the neighbors. The Dursleys had a small son called Dudley and in their opinion there was no finer boy anywhere.

The Dursleys had everything they wanted, but they also had a secret, and their greatest fear was that somebody would discover it. They didn\'t think they could bear it if anyone found out about the Potters. Mrs. Potter was Mrs. Dursley\'s sister, but they hadn\'t met for several years; in fact, Mrs. Dursley pretended she didn\'t have a sister, because her sister and her good-for-nothing husband were as unDursleyish as it was possible to be. The Dursleys shuddered to think what the neighbors would say if the Potters arrived in the street. The Dursleys knew that the Potters had a small son, too, but they had never even seen him. This boy was another good reason for keeping the Potters away; they didn\'t want Dudley mixing with a child like that.When Mr. and Mrs. Dursley woke up on the dull, gray Tuesday our story starts, there was nothing about the cloudy sky outside to suggest that strange and mysterious things would soon be happening all over the country. Mr. Dursley hummed as he picked out his most boring tie for work, and Mrs. Dursley gossiped away happily as she wrestled a screaming Dudley into his high chair.
None of them noticed a large, tawny owl flutter past the window.
Tracker

At half past eight, Mr. Dursley picked up his briefcase, pecked Mrs. Dursley on the cheek, and tried to kiss Dudley good-bye but missed, because Dudley was now having a tantrum and throwing his cereal at the walls.
